documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates from northamptonshire have now finished .
thanks for joining us this week .
you can follow the weekend 's football , rugby and formula 1 via the bbc sport website , or on our twitter feed .
and we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 , with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire .
see you then .

documents.title: weather : chance of frost tonight , but sunshine tomorrow
text: it will be a dry night with mainly clear skies and possibly a few fog patches .
there could be a touch of frost in sheltered spots , with a low of 2c ( 36f ) .
after a chilly start , saturday should be fine and dry with long spells of sunshine .
there 'll be a light to moderate north-easterly wind and inland temperatures could reach about 14c ( 57f ) .
there 's more at bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: families using relatives ' hospital stay 'to go on holiday or do home improvements '
text: bosses at northampton general hospital say people are using their relatives ' hospital stay to go on holiday or make home improvements `` without considering whether they will be back or building work will be complete when the relative is ready to be discharged '' .
the hospital says families are also `` failing to turn up for meetings with staff from the hospital and social care to discuss and agree discharge arrangements '' .

there are currently 15 patients who are medically fit for discharge but are unable to return home because their families are `` unwilling '' to take them home , or they are `` arguing and refusing a transfer of care to the community '' , the hospital claims .
bosses say they admitted their highest number of emergency patients over a seven-day period last week , and the failure to discharge healthy people added to that pressure .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: corby urgent care centre bosses prepared to keep it open , despite £ 30k a month loss
text: the saga around corby 's urgent care centre has taken another turn this afternoon
the organisation that runs it says it would be prepared to continue operating the service while it negotiates with the local clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) over funding .
earlier in the week lakeside plus said it would close the centre on the last day of march .
lakeside plus said the corby ccg does n't pay it enough per patient , causing the centre to run at a loss of £ 30,000 a month .
for its part , the ccg said this week that if necessary it would find another provider to keep the service running .
but now lakeside says while the two sides try to thrash out a deal , it would be prepared to continue .
it has written an open letter to the ccg outlining its plan to keep the centre open .
this is no doubt not the last we 'll hear on the matter
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: to all you mums out there # getinspired
text: with mother 's day coming up on sunday , let ironman athlete jon alexander tell you the story of his mum , sue , and how she has always been his inspiration
you can find out how to get into triathlon with our get inspired guide .

documents.title: priors hall 'an expensive disappointment '
text: the priors hall development was a major part of a `` north londonshire '' marketing campaign , which featured adverts voiced by sandi toksvig and described the area as `` idyllic '' .
however , homeowner julie mccallum ( said : `` when i look at the advert now it actually makes me laugh . ''
she continued : `` it cost us a lot of money to move .
what we thought we were buying and what we actually got were two very different things .
`` it 's been an expensive disappointment for us '' .

hughie coull , who has lived at priors hall for five years , told me : `` it looked nice and i thought there 'd be country walks , a pub , shops and play areas for the kids , but we 've got nothing . ''
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: priors hall and its 'stunning ' countryside
text: the website advertising houses at priors hall in corby says the development is `` set in 1,200 acres of parkland in northamptonshire '' .
it says it offers `` acres and acres of green open spaces and parkland '' , `` woodland walks '' and a `` stunning eight-acre lake '' .
however , it 's fair to say , visiting the site paints a very different
corby developments limited and bela partnership limited called in administrators deloitte in october 2016 .
delloite said in a statement it was `` now working to find a new investor to complete the development of the site '' .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: priors hall residents 'frustrated ' by corby 's 'north londonshire ' housing development
text: people living at priors hall park in corby say they 've given up waiting for amenities to be provided .
the development was a major part of a marketing campaign that branded corby and the surrounding area `` north londonshire '' , to encourage commuters to northamptonshire .
the first residents moved on to the development in 2010 and planning permission has been granted for 5,100 homes .
only about 600 have been built so far .
the companies behind the development went into administration last october .
administrators delloite said `` material progress '' was being made , although it acknowledged some residents were `` frustrated '' .
we 'll bring you homeowners ' thoughts shortly
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby health bosses say urgent care centre 'will not close '
text: in the last couple of days we 've been discussing the confusion over whether an urgent care centre in corby will remain open , with the current operators looking to pull out by the end of the month .
and i 'm afraid it 's getting more confusing than ever

the corby clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) has said in a new statement it is `` working to ensure that the urgent care centre will not close and that staff who deliver the services will continue after 31 march 2017 '' .
it says it will , if necessary , bring in a new provider if lakeside plus vacates the site .
however , yesterday lakeside plus said the centre would close next friday .
when its contract ends , unless funding from the nhs increased .

it said corby ccg had not put forward another provider and it owned the building and either owned or leased much of its equipment - so if a new provider came in it would need to work with lakeside plus .
it added it also employed the staff , not the ccg .
corby ccg said : `` lakeside plus has made a number of claims on which the ccg and their legal advisers do not agree '' , but did not give any specific examples .
so whether you 'll still be able to use the centre next week , or have to go to a & e in kettering for your ailments , remains unclear .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tyres worth £ 78,000 stolen from lorry at watford gap
text: about £ 78,000-worth of tyres have been stolen from a lorry park at the watford gap services on the m1 .
the lorry was parked in the northbound service area of the services , located between junctions 16 and 17 .
at sometime between 19:00 on wednesday and 02:00 on thursday , two holes were cut in the side and the tyres were taken , police said .
officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: red nose day : school in for 'pug-tastic ' treat
text: karen ferguson , a teaching assistant at pytchley primary school , has gone `` pug-tastic '' for this year 's red nose day .
that is an impressive mask
you can send us your red nose day via .
email , facebook or twitter .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: force india debut pink car
text: meanwhile , silverstone-based force india are hoping their new pink livery will win them over some new fans .
the vijay malia-owned team unveiled the new colour scheme last week , after they announced a new sponsor .
the new look was being seen for the first time today as the formula 1 season began in melbourne .
the teams chief operating officer , otmar szafnauer , said the car was `` striking '' and that `` you 'll know a force india from all the other [ teams ] '' .
he added that he hoped the performance would `` stand out '' like the car .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: lewis hamilton dominates australian grand prix practice
text: stevenage 's lewis hamilton put in a scintillating performance to set the pace in second practice at the season-opening australian grand prix .
he was 0.547secs clear of ferrari 's sebastian vettel in second , who was just 0.009secs quicker than hamilton 's brackley-based mercedes team-mate valtteri bottas .
hamilton 's margin over bottas will raise questions over whether it is car or driver that has the advantage .
hamilton led a mercedes one-two in first practice earlier .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Melbourne

documents.title: rugby : tigers 'pumped ' for saints clash
text: leicester tigers winger tom brady has said the squad are in no doubt about the importance of tomorrow 's midlands derby with northampton saints .
both tigers and saints are still in the .
hunt for the final premiership play-off place .
the former sale sharks winger said : `` it does not take too much motivating , the lads are already pumped for it .
`` leicester versus northampton is embedded in you when you come to this club .
it goes unsaid - it is a must win game for this club . ''
aaron mauger names his final tigers side at lunchtime .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy at first , breezy with sunshine later
text: this morning will be cloudy and breezy , but dry .
the cloud will gradually break up during the afternoon , so it will become sunny and mild later with a high of 12c ( 54f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire .
it 's a packed weekend of sport with football , rugby and formula 1 and we 'll build up to those .
plus we 'll be looking at priors hall in corby .
and it is of course red nose day , and if you have a comic relief event going on today the please email us or tweet us .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 , with a look at priors hall in corby , the saints and cobblers both at home this weekend and the start of the new formula 1 season .
and , of course , it is comic relief .
we 'll see you then .

documents.title: overnight weather : turning cloudy from the east
text: a chilly but bright end to the day with sunny spells across the bbc east region .
it will turn a little cloudy from the east during the evening and overnight , but the breeze will keep temperatures a little higher , with lows in the west dropping to 3 or 4c ( 37-40f ) .
on friday , any early cloud will clear to give brighter weather with sunny spells .
feeling warmer than today in many places , but still cooler on the coast in the north-easterly wind .
top temperature 12c ( 54f ) .
wherever you live , you can get a full forecast from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: have your say on plans to dual more of the a47
text: if you 're wondering what the latest is on plans to dual the a47 in cambridgeshire - nip over to the haycock hotel this evening .
highways england is putting all the plans on display until 20:00 .
it 's all part of a massive improvement programme for six sections of the 115-mile a47 between peterborough and the east coast .
among the proposals - dualling the 1.5-mile single carriageway between wansford and sutton - and improving the a47 junction at guyhirn .
if you 're a regular motorist round there you know how congested they get .
today we 're at haycock hotel discussing wansford to sutton dualling of the a47 until 8pm
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: closure of corby urgent care centre 'not an option ' , say councils
text: corby borough council says the closure of corby urgent care centre `` is not an option and we are talking to both parties to see if they can come together to resolve the issue '' .

john mcghee , the councillor responsible for health , said that if lakeside plus , which currently runs the centre , ca n't reach an agreement with the clinical commissioning group then there should be a `` seamless transition '' to another provider .
lakeside plus has said that the centre will close in eight days ' time , while the ccg denies this will happen .
mr mcghee said that should the centre close it would put a `` real strain on kettering general hospital '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: internationals have 'added edge ' to northampton saints , says luther burrell
text: northampton saints centre luther burrell says they will be `` right in the mix '' for a top-four finish if they can beat leicester tigers on saturday .
saints are sixth in the premiership , four points behind fourth-placed bath .
england international burrell , 29 , is available to make his comeback after eight weeks out injured .
`` the contacts are a little bit more physical because everyone is getting themselves mentally into the place they need to be to compete , '' he said .

saints , who missed out on last season 's play-offs , finishing fifth in the table , five points adrift of leicester , will also be boosted by the return of members of england 's six nations title-winning squad .
`` we are in a position where if we put in a good performance this weekend we are right back in the mix , '' burrell told bbc radio northampton .
`` we ca n't get ahead of ourselves .
the story of our season has been like a rollercoaster but we 've got our internationals back - they 've added a bit of edge in training this week . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: man stabbed in higham ferrers
text: a 23-year-old man was stabbed as he walked home from a shop in higham ferrers last night .
it happened between 22:10 and 22.30 on the corner of stimpson avenue and newman street .
the victim was approached from behind by two males , police said .
he suffered a 1cm wound to his right rib cage and cuts to his right hand .
the victim was then wrestled to the ground before his head was then stamped on , leaving a mark .
the offenders then fled the scene without stealing anything or making any further threats .
police have posted a description of the alleged attackers on their website .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london attack : corby mp in 'close proximity ' to attacker being shot
text: tom pursglove , the mp for corby and east northants , has posted a statement on his facebook page about yesterday 's attack in london .

it reads : `` i can confirm that i was witness to part of the attack and saw , at close proximity , the assailant being shot by a police officer , in what was a great act of bravery in order to protect the lives of others .

`` this was obviously a very unpleasant and upsetting experience for all those who bore witness to it and i was particularly grateful to the prime minister who took the time to call me last night - this was extremely kind of her , given all that was going on .

`` yesterday 's events come as a real shock , but i am pleased the house of commons is sitting today and quite rightly paid tribute to the remarkable pc [ keith ] palmer [ who was killed ] and all those caught up in this tragedy .

`` the prime minister summed up the situation extremely eloquently in her statement earlier and i associate myself with every word that she said - our democracy will never be silenced , or our values defeated . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: directors at corby urgent care centre say it will close at the end of the month
text: the situation surrounding the fate of the corby urgent care centre has again become rather unclear .
yesterday , lakeside plus , which currently runs the centre , said it would close the facility at the end of the month , but health bosses in corby say it 's staying open .
however , a new statement sent to us from lakeside plus says it is `` dismayed by the total lack of negotiations as the countdown clock for closure reaches eight days to go '' .
lakeside plus says it is not pulling out of the contract to run the centre early , and indeed has provided extracts of the contract for us to see .
this states its agreement with the local clinical commissioning group runs out on 31 march .
it also says that the ccg has not put forward a new provider for the centre , nor does the ccg own the building or many pieces of equipment in the centre .
it ends by saying it does `` not want to close '' and thanks people who came to protest this morning .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: news round-up : no more free beer , magical mother 's day , and waste mix up
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : turning dry into the weekend , with plenty of sunshine
text: cloud will gradually start to clear through the afternoon , with increasing amounts of sunshine .
a stiff , rather chilly north-easterly wind will develop , making it feel cool with a high of 12c ( 54f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: north on alleged bite , wales & lions

documents.title: cost of a6 repairs £ 500,000 and rising
text: northamptonshire highways says it has already spent £ 500,000 on the work to improve the a6 .
engineers have found empty spaces , or `` voids '' , in the infill that supports the road surface at two bridges - one over the river ise and the other over a rail line .
leon jelly , the project manager , says they `` do n't know the final figure '' of the repairs .
the county council has asked the government for help in paying for the work .
a small section of the southbound carriageway from braybrooke will open today , but rebecca millar from northamptonshire highways says they are working on ways to minimise traffic on local roads .
they have spoken to haulage companies to try and ensure hgvs use the 16-mile diversion route .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: george north : wales wing 'disappointed ' at no action over alleged bite
text: george north : wales wing 'disappointed ' at no action over alleged bite

documents.title: tom youngs : racism and homophobia in football dressing rooms
text: former footballer tom youngs has lifted the lid on some of the `` banter '' that used to be prevalent in the dressing room during his playing days .
youngs , who is now battling multiple sclerosis , said most of the comments made were good natured , but added racism and homophobia were n't uncommon .
he said homophobia was used `` as a way to knock somebody , particularly young lads coming through at 17 or 18 '' .
`` it was n't always a particularly kind environment , '' he said .
`` i can understand why there have n't been any out gay footballers while playing .
it would be a very , very difficult place to be . ''
he added dressing rooms were often a place for `` casual racism , '' saying while things have improved outwardly in the game , there remains an element of `` institutionalised racism '' .
`` with the amount of black players who have graced our game in the last 30 years , there is no easy explanation as to why there are so few black coaches , '' he said .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Sport

documents.title: tom youngs : a level success brought striker 'boffin ' nickname
text: former cambridge united and northampton town striker tom youngs was n't your average footballer , coming into the game with a levels in english , maths and french .
towards the end of his career he added a degree in sports journalism from staffordshire university to his list of academic achievements .
the crowd at cambridge used to chant `` tom youngs has got a levels '' and team-mates called him `` boffin '' .
and , while he says that helped him form a point of difference which allowed him to integrate in to the dressing room , youngs admits there were times when the `` banter '' was too much .
`` most of it is good natured and friendly , '' he said .
`` but unfortunately it is n't all like that .
`` i found it difficult sometimes and had to get away .
`` it is a really blokey , macho world .
that 's understandable when you are stripping lads straight out of school , chucking them into what is essentially an extension of school . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Sport

documents.title: george north says there is 'more to come ' from him for saints
text: after a shaky performance against scotland , george north is back in pole position for a lions squad spot in new zealand this summer , having scored two tries against ireland and performing solidly against france .
`` there 's more to come , '' he said .
`` i have five games [ with northampton ] to get back to where i know i can be . ''
north won three lions test caps in the australia series victory four years ago .
`` i was lucky enough to tour with the lions in 2013 and remember how special that was , '' said north .
`` with the season we have had , you hope your best performances get you there .
`` touch wood , we have five games to put another claim down and hope you have done enough to warrant selection .
`` there is no tougher place to tour than new zealand .
wales toured there last year and it was one of the toughest places i have been in - playing the all blacks in their own backyard .
`` they are not world champions for nothing . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: wales need 'consistency ' , says north
text: wales finished fifth in the six nations , their lowest position since 2007 , with wins against italy and ireland but defeats against england , scotland and france .
`` from our own standards it was not the best from a personal or a team point of view , '' george north told me .
`` we showed glimpses of some really good rugby . ''
the 24-year-old added : `` it is just having the consistency and putting performances back-to-back .
`` if you look at the france game we dug into the end and lost .
`` it is the whole game performance we speak about .
`` overall it was a decent six nations but we know we have another level or two in us . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: george north 'disappointed ' at no action over alleged bite
text: wales wing george north says he was disappointed no action was taken over an alleged bite on him in wales ' .
six nations defeat against france .
referee wayne barnes asked television match official peter fitzgibbon to check the incident , but he could not find any clear footage .
citing commissioner john montgomery was also .
unable to find clear evidence .
`` from my point of view it was disappointing as was the whole game , '' north told me during bbc radio northampton 's saints show .
he continued : `` i have got a bit of bruise on it now from obviously where i got bitten but apart from that i am alright really .
`` it is disappointing [ no action was taken ] because you think what the modern game is like , especially in a test match because it was , wales v france in paris which is such a big occasion .
`` it is what it is .
sometimes for all the cameras that are there they capture stuff and sometimes they do n't .
`` this one time it does n't got up . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: protests outside corby urgent care centre this morning
text: a small number of people have gathered outside the corby urgent care centre to protest against any proposed closure .
lakeside plus , which currently runs the centre , said it would close the centre at the end of the month , but health bosses in corby say it 's staying open .
the protesters say it would be `` devastating '' if the centre closes .
they are concerned that the ccg , which funds the centre , only made a statement after there were claims it would shut , and hope to have more reassurances soon .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ccg tells mp that corby urgent care centre is not closing
text: yesterday , .
managers said they would close .
the corby urgent care centre next friday , 31 march , in a row over nhs funding .
however , .
in a letter to the corby mp tom pursglove , local health bosses at corby ccg say the centre `` is not closing '' .
the ccg says it is `` working urgently '' to keep the centre open - with lakeside plus , which currently runs the centre , or `` with another provider if necessary '' .
it admits the announcement yesterday `` caused some disquiet for the people of corby '' , but says suggestions the centre will close are `` misleading '' .
a letter from @ twitterid regarding # corby urgent care centre :
tom , will you be investigating why the ccg is n't paying the required rates ( as stated in the nt article ) ?
lakeside plus provide an excellent service , please do not allow this to deteriate .
@ twitterid @ twitterid thank you the confirmation but i still ask that you look into the issue ref underfunding
rather underlines frailty of contracted-out nhs though .
far too much make do and mend .
extremely worrying .
r
if they 're pulling out of the contract early they need to be hit with significant financial penalty for doing so
@ twitterid @ twitterid thank you for throwing some light on this matter .
it was announced on the local bbc news this evening that corby ucc was to close next week .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'it 's scary , i keep my fingers crossed '
text: 'it 's scary , i keep my fingers crossed '
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london attack : daventry council leader in westminster and 'heard gun shots '
text: chris millar , the leader of daventry district council , says he was `` only yards away '' from the terror attack in westminster yesterday .
he said that he arrived at westminster at about 14:30 to meet the daventry mp chris heaton-harris , and was in the security hub when the attack happened .
mr millar said : `` you could tell something was wrong because everyone was moving wildly , then moments later you heard three [ gun ] shots . ''
he said those that had gone through security into new palace yard `` were ushered back in '' .
he said he `` did n't know what was going on '' and was `` told not to go outside '' .
mr millar ended up being locked in parliament for five hours .
for a while they `` did n't know what was happening '' but said `` the police and the security service were absolutely fantastic '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london attack : northants police chief pays tribute to officer killed
text: simon edens , the chief constable of northamptonshire police , has said he is `` extremely proud '' of the police response to events in westminster .
he also paid tribute to pc keith palmer , who died in yesterday 's attack in london , and said his `` heart goes out '' to his family , friends and colleagues .
the flag at our hq is at half mast to honour pc keith palmer & the other innocent victims from yesterday 's attacks .
# westminsterattack # rip
@ twitterid it 's also at half mast at rushden fire station # ripkeithpalmer
thanks , good to hear .
2 for rushden town councils event team proud to protect the public
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: turning drier and brighter
text: early rain will clear to leave a dry and bright day , with some sunny spells .
inland temperatures will reach 11c ( 52f ) , but the chilly easterly breeze will keep it cooler on the coast .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning ,
we are back bringing you live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll have more on the a6 repairs , which yesterday we found out would carry on until september , and also more on the corby urgent care centre .
but first up the region 's weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
for most of this afternoon we 've been focusing on the ongoing attacks in westminster .
you can get the latest on this story .
here .
we 'll be back with rolling news , sport , weather and travel updates tomorrow from 08:00 .
see you again soon .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: still unclear what 's happening to corby 's urgent care centre
text: i 'm afraid the waters are still muddy regarding the future of corby 's urgent care centre .

lakeside plus , which runs the facility , says it is not being funded properly by the corby clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) and the contract it has with the ccg finishes on friday , 31 march - meaning it will close its doors .
but that 's been countered by the ccg this afternoon .
it says it will stay open - whether the current operators want it to or not .
so it 's left corby residents in a state of limbo , with them not knowing whether they 'll need to go to kettering 's a & e in future if they need aid .
we 've yet to get any more news confirmed , but we 'll be working on it overnight and we 'll bring you the latest in the morning .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: london attack : transport police to increase patrols across network
text: following events in london earlier this afternoon , british transport police has told me extra officers will be out tonight , across the whole british rail network , not just london , `` to reassure '' people .
no specific numbers of how many extra officers have been given , and there 's no indication as to whether they 'll be armed or not .
to be clear , they say it 's just to reassure people , and not because of a specific threat .
but you could see a bigger presence going home tonight .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: 'dynamic ' saints ready for tigers clash
text: 'dynamic ' saints ready for tigers clash

documents.title: london attack : 'terrible , terrible afternoon '
text: corby and east northants mp tom pursglove , who was at westminster when the attacks happened , has been tweeting his condolences to the victims

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight with outbreaks of rain
text: tonight will be rather cloudy , with outbreaks of rain spreading east to west .
lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
a rather cloudy start to the day tomorrow , but becoming brighter with sunny spells and the chance of an isolated shower .
but most places staying dry .
top temperature of 11c ( 52f ) .
weather has more local details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: london attack : northampton mp speaks from chamber
text: the mp for northampton south , david mackintosh , has been in the commons chamber since parliament was locked down earlier .
he told us there was confusion as the situation unfolded .
`` i headed over to the voting lobby and mps were running saying there were reports of gunshots being fired .
people were worried about what was happening .
`` we 're just sitting in the chamber waiting .
we 're resilient .
we all carry on with our jobs because we all expect that , at some point in our jobs , we will come under attack .
`` unfortunately it 's a modern part of our lives as members of parliament .
`` we all receive threats and we try to work through those . ''
see here for the latest updates on this story .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: parliament 'under the control of security ' , says wellingborough mp
text: we 've just spoken to the mp for wellingborough , peter bone , who 's locked inside the palace of westminster .
he said : `` people are obviously anxious but we 're probably in the safest place in the country at the moment .
`` we are completely under the control of security and , to be honest , we really do n't know what 's going on .
`` we 're just waiting to be told where to go next .
the main thing at the moment is to make sure everyone is ok . ''
he said he was in the tearoom with corby mp tom pursglove when the shots were fired by police .
we 're catching up with all our mps and will bring the latest news to you .
visit here for the latest updates on this story .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: westminster incidents : kettering mp told not to leave office
text: kettering mp philip hollobone has spoken to us from his office in parliament .
`` it 's very strange , '' he said .
`` most mps are locked in the commons chamber itself , as a vote was taking place when this started .
`` i actually got back to my office but nobody can get anywhere .
everything is locked down .
`` there are always lots of police officers with machine guns around westminster .
the security is intense and we must pay tribute to them .
`` when something happens they react incredibly quickly . ''
we 've contacted all of northamptonshire 's mps .
peter bone ( wellingborough ) and chris heaton-harris ( daventry ) have replied to say that they are safe .
we 've yet to hear back from the others .
click here for the latest updates on this story .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: corby urgent care centre 'not closing '
text: there 's confusion over the future of corby 's nhs urgent care centre .
earlier , managers there said they 'd close it next friday , 31 march , in a row over nhs funding .
but a spokeswoman for the corby clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) has told us : `` corby urgent care centre is not closing .
`` the organisation running the centre has given notice that they wish to withdraw from their contract at the end of march , but it is not their role to decide whether the service comes to an end .
`` that decision rests with the ccg as commissioners of healthcare for the people of corby , and we will ensure that the service continues - with another provider if necessary .
`` we are now working urgently to make that happen . ''
we 'll try and make the waters less muddy for you and bring you the latest when we get it .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: what we know so far about situation at parliament
text: what we know so far :
read more here .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'stampede of people ' run from parliament
text: at 14:20 there was a stampede of people running away from parliament .
police blowing whistles , stopping traffic and telling people to run .
ambulance arrives at westminster
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: weather : more showers this afternoon
text: we 've already had some heavy rain in northamptonshire this lunchtime and there 's more to come .
if you 're really lucky you might catch a bright or even sunny spell in-between .
maximum temperature 8c ( 46f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: a6 closure update : mixed news for drivers
text: we 've had an update about the seemingly never-ending closure of the a6 bypass around desborough and rothwell .
the bad news is that major engineering work has been extended until september at the earliest .
but there is some good news - they 're going to trial reopening the southbound lane between braybrooke road and the a14 junction .
this will begin tomorrow after the morning rush-hour to try and relieve pressure on roads through desborough and rothwell , which drivers have been using as an unofficial diversion route .
the road was initially closed in january when problems were found with the foundations of a bridge over the river ise .
engineers then discovered more severe damage on a bridge nearby , which goes over the railway line .
repairs were supposed to be completed by the end of april , but are taking longer than expected because of `` logistical problems in carrying out repairs over a live railway line '' .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: corby urgent care centre closure : doctors 'short-changed '
text: managers at the corby urgent care centre say they have no choice but to close it next friday because of a lack of funding .
they claim the centre is supposed to receive £ 57 per patient from the nhs , but is actually getting no more than £ 44.50 .
a spokesman for the centre said : `` the clinical commissioning groups have been short-changing doctors who run the centre and , as a result , the centre has run at a loss in recent years . ''
we have asked the corby and nene clinical commissioning groups for their reaction and will bring you this when we hear back .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: breakingcorby urgent care centre to close
text: the nhs urgent care centre in corby is to close next friday , 31 march .
managers claim it 's not being funded properly by the corby clinical commissioning group .
the centre on cottingham road was opened in 2012 and sees more than 200 patients a day , of which 75 are children .

dr martin mcgrath of corby urgent care centre said : `` the centre has not only hugely reduced attendances at local a & e departments , but it has also saved the nhs at least £ 2.5m per annum over what it would cost to treat the same patients at the crowded kettering a & e department .
`` we refer less than 10 patients a day to kettering general hospital a & e .
`` this delivers an excellent outcome for patients and great benefit to the healthcare system around us and wider nhs . ''
we 'll bring you more reaction to this story as we get it .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: victim of contaminated blood still hoping for compensation
text: a northamptonshire man says he 's still hoping for compensation after being given the all-clear from hepatitis c .
matthew harris , 44 , from brixworth , is a haemophiliac and has needed regular blood transfusions all his life .
at the age of 11 he became one of about 6,000 people in the uk to be infected with hepatitis c after being given contaminated blood imported from america by the nhs .
he only found out about 10 years ago and his condition has , at times , been so bad that he has been unable to work .
mr harris said : `` it 's not just the money .
i 'm 44 now and i 've had this for 30-plus years .
`` it 's the journeys to and from hospital , the times i 've been for tests to check the damage to my liver .
`` it 's the time off work , the trouble it 's put my wife and children through .
`` i would say i am still looking for some kind of financial help . ''
the government said it was considering improvements to the support system .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: northampton 'stifled ' from becoming more prosperous
text: it 's claimed northampton should be given new powers and freedoms to make a success of brexit .
the think tank localis says it 's one of 28 towns across england which need extra help from the government to `` revive '' their economies .
it wants local authorities to be given more powers to expand , set taxes , improve local transport and offer incentives to attract the right talent for local businesses .
liam booth-smith , chief executive of localis , said : `` some parts of england have n't recovered from the economic trauma of the 1980s .
`` these , the most 'stuck ' economies in the country , are of increasing political importance .
`` we need to expand economic policy out from big cities to small town england . ''

secretary of state for the department for business , energy and industrial strategy , greg clark , said : `` the prime minister has made clear that we need to 'drive growth across the country ' and our industrial strategy will not ignore this reality .
`` local civic and business leaders will be central to ensuring the government 's vision of a country sharing in the prosperity of growth .
`` i am hoping for as much feedback and collaboration as possible from councils , businesses , universities , colleges and communities .
this localis report is an important contribution to that effort . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : early glimpses of sunshine
text: it 's been a rather cloudy and drizzly morning , but early risers were treated to some brightness , as captured by our bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: money spent on consultants defended by nhs bosses
text: we reported earlier how the nhs in northamptonshire spent about £ 720,000 looking at ways of cutting costs and saving money .
management consultancy company mckinsey 's received £ 500,000 of that .
the nene clinical commissioning group says the research had to be carried out as part of national sustainability and transformation .
plans ( stp ) , and this consultancy company offered the `` best value for money '' .
a spokeswoman said : `` the development of the stp was a significant piece of major system-wide strategic work that needed to be undertaken within a nationally mandated timescale .
`` the main driver behind mckinsey 's work was to support the development of new models of care in out-of-hospital services around a gp federation model .
`` a tendering process was followed involving a shortlist of three providers .
mckinsey 's provided the best value of money in terms of deliverable outcome 's and costs . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: money spent by nhs on consultants who work out where to save cash criticised
text: the amount of money the nhs in northamptonshire has spent on consultancy fees for new national .
sustainability and transformation plans has been criticised by the british medical association ( bma ) .
about £ 720,000 has been spent in the county to look at ways of cutting costs and saving money , with £ 500,000 of that spent on one consultancy firm from the united states .
it 's the fifth highest amount spent on the project nationally .
mark porter from the bma said : `` money can always be spent better if it 's being paid out to management consultants and is probably not going to be much use at the end of the day , '' he said .

`` what we are seeing , and these are examples from around the country , is reductions in the availability of certain types of surgery ; we 're seeing every performance indicator in the nhs slide gradually downwards ; we 're seeing providers pushed into almost a perpetual state of deficit , and general practice literally buckling under the pressure of inadequate funding .
`` every area of the nhs could really do with the money that 's being paid out on these plans at the moment . ''
we 'll bring you the response from the nhs shortly .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : rain moving in by lunchtime
text: if it looks bright and cheerful out there now , make the most of it , as a band of rain is set to move in from the west later today .
cloud will thicken , bringing some showery outbreaks of rain from the south-west during the afternoon .
some rain may locally turn heavy , with hail possible , and brisk , south-easterly winds , which will be strongest near coasts .
maximum temperature 8c ( 46f ) .
best get the washing out on the line early , and get it back in by lunchtime

documents.title: welcome to today 's live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates from northamptonshire .
we 'll be here from now until 18:00 bringing you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel .
first up , the weather and we 'll have a full regional forecast for you shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and overnight , but we 'll be back fully at 08:00 .
see you then .

documents.title: a mainly dry night with clear spells
text: a mostly dry night with a few isolated showers .
temperatures falling in places to as low as 1c ( 33f ) .
tomorrow will start fine , dry and chilly .
it 'll become cloudy with showery later in the afternoon , with some hail mixed in .
temperatures reaching a high of 10c ( 50f ) .
you can find more details on bbc weather for where you live .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: new council hq inspected by bosses
text: last week we brought you news about delays for county council staff moving in to the new headquarters in northampton town centre .
project angel was due to open in 2016 , but now staff wo n't be moving until the middle of april .
the authority 's chief executive paul blatern has been inspecting the building , ahead of the move .

documents.title: jobs and prosperity after brexit to be discussed in northampton tonight
text: tonight there is a `` question time '' style event about brexit at the county council chamber , organised by the university of northampton .
it 's the first of three events due to take place .
adrian pryce , senior business lecturer at the university , said tonight 's event would be about `` jobs and prosperity '' and feature a panel of businesses , industry experts and local politicians .
mr pryce told me he feels the key for business at the moment is `` stability and certainty '' .
he said once the uk exits the eu , companies `` want to be able to bring talent in '' and have `` access to markets '' .
he added businesses want the status of current eu nationals in the uk clarified , so there is `` no disruption to existing jobs '' .
mr pryce also told me there had been `` some denial '' among pro-eu businesses , but the mood was `` changing '' and businesses were carrying on and planning for brexit .
he said there were `` some green shoots '' that the post-brexit economy would be strong , but warned there would be `` some short-term cost for the luxury of exiting the eu '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: cobblers ' tie against oxford 'a cup final '
text: meanwhile , northampton town 's match against oxford at sixfields on saturday is `` huge '' , according to david kerslake .
he told me the club `` still need points to make us mathematically safe '' , adding that until then `` every game is a cup final '' .
the games against oxford have had a extra bit of extra s this season .
oxford united manager michael appleton said his side had been `` the best team '' in league two last year , despite finishing second to the cobblers .
northampton then won the game in oxford on boxing day , with a last minute winner from marc richards .
however , kerslake said although they `` know it is important to the supporters '' , to the management team `` it 's just another game to us '' .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: cobblers hoping refereeing decisions will 'even themselves out ' after bolton loss
text: northampton town assistant manager david kerslake has told me they should have come away from bolton with `` at least a point '' , after the cobblers lost 2-1 .

they were on the wrong end of two refereeing decisions when bolton were awarded a 75th penalty for handball , and john-joe o'toole thought he had equalised in the final minute of stoppage time but his effort was disallowed for offside .
kerslake praised his players , saying `` defensively we were excellent '' , and hoped over the course of the season any refereeing decisions will `` even themselves out '' .

he said bolton was one of a few `` huge clubs '' in league one that the club would have get results against `` if we are going to compete '' , but added : `` the players have shown they can handle any arena . ''
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and some showers , occasionally wintry
text: it will be an afternoon of sunshine and scattered showers , these falling as sleet or hail at times , especially across the hills .
it 'll feel colder than recent days in the brisk wind , with some strong gusts at times and a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council has 'low base ' to fund social care , says expert
text: northamptonshire county council has been `` treated badly '' by central government , according to an expert on the funding of social care .

jonathan carr-west , chief executive of the local government information unit , said authorities like northamptonshire were `` for years encouraged to keep council tax low and were given grants to do so '' .
councils will now be able to increase council tax by an extra 3 % , above the 1.99 % they are allowed without a referendum , .
to help fund social care .
however , mr carr-west said northamptonshire and similar councils `` have a lower base to work from '' than councils that consistently increased the tax .
the government says it has increased funding for social care by an additional £ 900m , meaning councils will have £ 7.6bn of dedicated funding to spend over the four-year period .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hartley 'an outstanding captain ' , says england coach jones
text: england head coach eddie jones has defended his captain dylan hartley .
the northampton saints hooker skippered the national side to a second successive six nations , but has consistently been replaced during the third quarter of games by jamie george .
`` dylan is an outstanding captain and does a super job .
there 's no reason why he wo n't continue to do a super job , '' jones said .
he continued : `` it 's like when mike brearley captained the england cricket team - everyone questioned him , then he won the ashes and no-one questioned him .
`` i thought he [ hartley ] was better than he was in november - and there 's no reason why , the next time he comes in , he ca n't be better than he was this time .
`` as long as he keeps improving , he 's in the right direction , like every other player . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former northampton saints wing sean lamont to retire at the end of the season
text: veteran glasgow wing sean lamont , scotland 's third most-capped player , is set to bring the curtain down on a 17-year career at the end of the season .
lamont , 36 , joined saints in 2005 , playing 68 games and scoring over 100 points , including .
scoring four tries in a game against saracens in 2006 .
he said : `` i love the sport , i love being in it and i love the guys i work with .
but i just do n't have the gas anymore .
i ca n't get through those holes i see .
i can still truck it up a distance , but there is definitely a blunting of the axe . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: two stands demolished at nene park
text: two stands demolished at nene park

documents.title: no six nations action over alleged bite on george north
text: six nations officials will not take any action over an alleged bite on wales wing george north , during saturday 's .
20-18 loss to france .
referee wayne barnes asked television match official peter fitzgibbon to check the incident , but he could not find any clear footage so the game resumed without action being taken .
citing commissioner john montgomery was also unable to find clear evidence .
six nations rugby said it `` anticipates that this will be the end of the matter in terms of the alleged bite '' .
north has now returned to northampton saints , and we hope to hear from him later this week .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and the odd shower
text: it 'll be a mostly dry and sunny day , but one or two showers are possible .
it 'll feel colder than of late with a brisk wind , and a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
here is my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .

BBC Look East weather

text: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire .
we will be bringing you news , weather , sport and travel for the county between now and 18:00 .
there will be some rugby news to bring you , and look at the cost of social care .

documents.title: weather : chilly tonight with sunshine and showers tomorrow
text: there will be a few blustery showers tonight , some with sleet or hail , but much of the time dry with long clear spells .
becoming cold with a risk of patchy frost as temperatures fall to 1c ( 34f ) - perhaps limited somewhat by the strength of the south-westerly wind .
it will be a chilly start to tuesday with some lengthy spells of sunshine .
cloud will bubble-up through the day with a few isolated showers developing , perhaps locally heavy with some hail .
feeling cold in the brisk south-westerly wind , with temperatures reaching highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .

BBC Look East weather

text: saints sign blues fly-half francis

text: the cricket season starts for northants on 7 april , so the team are currently in the west indies playing some warm weather games .
today they are taking on hampshire , but it being cricket , it 's raining !
rain !
yes even in barbados !
the players leave the field with nccc on 69-0 ( 22.4 ) - holden 37 , newton 28 .
# norvham
@ twitterid well it would n't be cricket if there was n't rain delays !

documents.title: saints ' picamoles up for player of the six nations
text: northampton saints ' french number eight louis picamoles is .
among 12 players shortlisted for the 2017 six nations player of the championship award .
he is nominated alongside team-mate camille lopez - the 2017 top points scorer .
also nominated are england trio owen farrell , maro itoje and joe launchbury , while .
last year 's winner stuart hogg .
and scotland team-mate finn russell could take the gong .
scrum-half conor murray and back row cj stander are contenders for ireland .
wales ' scrum-half rhys webb and hooker ken owens are also included , as is italy captain sergio parisse .
voting is open to the public on .
the six nations website .
and closes at 12:00 on 21 march .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: saints sign back piers francis from new zealand
text: northampton saints have signed back piers francis from the new zealand super rugby team blues for the start of next season .
the 26-year-old was born in kent , but moved to new zealand aged 18 .
francis has had stints at both edinburgh and doncaster in the uk , before signing for the blues , who play out of auckland .
the back , who plays at fly-half and centre , could potentially face some of his future saints team-mates when the blues play a warm-up game against the british and irish lions on 7 june .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : steady rain , then turning colder
text: outbreaks of rain will continue to spread across northamptonshire this afternoon , becoming persistent and sometimes heavy .
only clearing by evening , with a high of 12c ( 54f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: australian grand prix : formula 1 returns , but will changes make it better ?
text: the crisis is over .
at least that is how it seems on the eve of arguably the most important formula 1 season for a long time .

after three years in which the sport agonised over declining television audiences , a lack of competition on the track , uninspiring cars and an apparently large number of disgruntled fans , f1 seems to be back on track .
`` the car is amazing in terms of the speed we carry through the corners , '' three-time world champion and stevenage hero lewis hamilton said of his brackley-based mercedes .
`` it is definitely the fastest i have ever been in f1 . ''
i 've taken a detailed look at the new cars , the changes made to them and whether they will make any difference .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: in nene park demolition continues
text: work to demolish nene park in irthlingborough is continuing .
the stadium , which was home to rushden and diamonds and then briefly kettering town , has been empty since 2012 .
this was the scene at the weekend , where two stands have now been razed to the ground .
it 's still not known what will happen to the site once cleared in three months ' time .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: callum bland death : information still wanted over arson for 'closure '
text: northamptonshire police says it would welcome any new information about the death of callum bland 10 years ago .
two teenagers .
were arrested in 2011 , but no-one has ever been charged over the fire which killed the wellingborough three-year-old .

graham lawman , who represents hemmingwell on wellingborough council and helped the family in the aftermath of the fire , said any prosecution relating to callum 's death would bring `` closure for the family '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: callum bland death : incident 'leaves a scar ' , says firefighter a decade on
text: mark ainge , one of the firefighters who attended the blaze that killed callum bland 10 years ago , said he had `` nightmares and flashbacks '' after the incident .
he told me the memory of the three-year-old 's death `` lived with many of the firefighters '' .
`` it leaves a scar , '' he said .
the fire on 19 march 2007 spread through the house from a wheelie bin that had been set on fire deliberately , but no-one has ever been brought to justice .
mr ainge said it was `` very , very difficult for the community and for the firefighters who responded to the incident '' .
however , he told me the toddler 's death `` provides a great deal of motivation to work on prevention to try and prevent something similar happening again '' .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: callum bland death : three-year-old killed in house fire 10 years ago
text: it 's 10 years since the death of callum bland in a house fire in wellingborough .
in the early hours of monday , 19 march 2007 , someone rested a wheelie bin against the wall of a house on fulmar lane and set the bin alight .
the three-year-old boy died after the flames spread to the house .
no-one has ever been prosecuted over callum 's death .
there had been 41 arson attacks in the hemmingwell area of wellingborough in the year before the toddler 's death , but this was the most notorious .
his mother , jane , her partner and three other children aged five , 17 months and five months , escaped .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: france v wales : six nations officials to review incidents at end of game
text: six nations officials are reviewing events in the closing stages of .
wales ' 20-18 loss to france , .
including an alleged bite on wing george north .
northampton saints ' north said he was bitten in the build-up to france 's final try .
referee wayne barnes asked television match official peter fitzgibbon to check the incident , but he could not find any clear footage so the game resumed without action being taken .
six nations rugby said an independent citing commissioner would review `` all relevant incidents '' and raise any issues in due course , normally within 48 hours of the end of the match .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: monday 's weather advice : you 're going to need your brolly
text: it 's a grey and damp start to the week with some patchy rain first thing , although some places will start dry .
rain will spread across all parts during the day , heavy in places , with a fairly brisk breeze as well .
top temperature between 9c and 13c ( 48f to 55f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning

we 'll be bringing you all the news , weather , sport and travel you need for the county .
we 've got news on the weekend 's eventful end to the six nations among other things .
but first up the full weather forecast .
